channel.title: K Well here is it is
channel.description:
I Got my 5 free ubuntu cd's today :)
So i want to install it on my AMD Sempron PC.
But i also want to keep windows aswell :)
How can i do this?

item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

[quote=“Zach1188, post:14, topic:62726”][quote author=wonderguy6 link=topic=90620.msg959636#msg959636 date=1172902752]

no white writing when i boot its only in safe mode :’(

Well its just a black screen after the windows boot screen

Is it a bunch if scrolling text with the names of .sys files?

Yes. but it just stays there. it dosent go away.
[/quote]
Post the last .sys (or other) file that appears. Maybe it’s a problem with a low-level driver.[/quote]
Nevermind. what i did was went on my ubuntu partaion of my comp tottaly uninstalled it and started up safe mode and it worked!!!

Now how do i get normally working cause it still shows the black screen after bootscreen. on normal.

item.dc:creator: @jcs_double jcs_double
item.description:
@jcs_double wrote:

Ubuntu comes with its own partitioner simply boot and install and grub(a part of Linux) will automatically detect any os’s that you have and make a menu for you to select which to boot

item.title: K Well here is it is
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

FAK!

Well. i read up on partitioning for Dual-=Boot.

Followed every single tut i could find. and i watch a vid tut anyway i went onto the ubuntu installation and i was on the bit about keyboard then i had to take it the disk out. i clicked shutdown then turned my computer back then i went to boot settings and put it back to my HD but guess what? windows wont start. i comes up with the boot screen then just goes to a blank black screen -.-

So i restarted. pressed F8 then i went start in safe mode and well it came up with another black screen with white righting on it :S then it was stuck on that screen. HELP!

Read full topic
